body_html: @qbx2 Hm, I'm not sure what you mean? _pywrap_tensorflow.so exists in that location, and if you're referring to @rpath/libcudart.7.5.dylib, the file is in /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-7.5/lib, which is where my CUDA was installed (default location from NVIDIA installer). That's why I set DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH.
body_text: @qbx2 Hm, I'm not sure what you mean? _pywrap_tensorflow.so exists in that location, and if you're referring to @rpath/libcudart.7.5.dylib, the file is in /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-7.5/lib, which is where my CUDA was installed (default location from NVIDIA installer). That's why I set DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH.
body: @qbx2 Hm, I'm not sure what you mean? `_pywrap_tensorflow.so` exists in that location, and if you're referring to `@rpath/libcudart.7.5.dylib`, the file is in /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-7.5/lib, which is where my CUDA was installed (default location from NVIDIA installer). That's why I set DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH.
